meanings.definition: A table or data file giving the calculated positions of a celestial object at regular intervals throughout a period.
meanings.sent1: The ephemeris showed the exact location of the comet in the sky each night.
meanings.sent2: I found the ephemeris in the astronomy book, detailing the movement of planets.
meanings.sent3: The ephemeris seemed like a magical map guiding the stars on their journey.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an ephemeris of memories, each one carefully recorded and stored.
meanings.sent5: The ephemeris was like a time capsule, capturing the dance of the planets for eternity.

meanings.definition: A publication containing such tables or data.
meanings.sent1: The library had the latest ephemeris with updated planetary positions.
meanings.sent2: She eagerly awaited the new ephemeris to track the movement of the moon.
meanings.sent3: The ephemeris book was so thick, it could double as a doorstop.
meanings.sent4: In her hands, the ephemeris felt like a treasure trove of celestial secrets.
meanings.sent5: The ephemeris publication was a window to the universe, revealing its hidden patterns.
